StoryText: It's my birthday party and I am writing out my list of who I'm going to invite...
Question: Should I invite %FirstName:NPC:1%, the class bully?

OptionText.Text: No way. He is a bully! We stand up to bullies!
Invite him - keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
Don't invite %FirstName:NPC:1%, but tell him it was an accident.

OptionResult.Result: When %FirstName:NPC:1% found out that he didn't get an invite, he cornered me in the playground. I told him that it was what he deserved and before he could do anything, I went inside. It's not over.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: I stood up to a bully today! %FirstName:NPC:1% was not invited to my party, and it was worth it just to see the look on his face. But... I've made %FirstName:NPC:1% more of an enemy than ever now.

OptionResult.Result: %FirstName:NPC:1% was happy to have been invited, but at the party he was at his usual tricks. Nothing really bad happened, but a lot of my friends wondered why I had let him come.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: I invited the class bully, %FirstName:NPC:1%, to my party. My popularity with the rest of the class took a real bashing, but at least %FirstName:NPC:1% is less likely to duck my head in the toilet again.

OptionResult.Result: I tried to tell %FirstName:NPC:1% that I had forgotten to write him an invite, but he didn't believe me. My classmates think I was going to invite the guy who has been making their lives awful. Oh no!
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: White lies can backfire - better to be straight with people, especially if they are bullies who you are not inviting to your party. I guess I've learned my lesson.
